page.title: 02SOUTH ANSTON
page.content: South Anston is separated from North Anston by the A57 main road and Anston Brook. In recent years it has grown from a 19th century quarrying village to a small town with a number of large, private housing estates. Very few people actually work in the village and the closeness of the M1 motorway means that some people travel long distances to work. Most families have at least one car but there are regular bus services to Sheffield, Rotherham, Worksop and Dinnington. There is also a train service to Sheffield from Kiveton. Many inhabitants have moved out from Sheffield. Others are employed in professional jobs that mean frequent moves so there is quite a high turnover of population. The old village has been almost swamped by new building and its character changed.
